label: Description
value: Four bands on black ground; the second and fourth bands are identical and consist of Viking-like pattern in blue and green. First band consists of concentric rhomboids in various colors bordered by triangles in veined yellow and red. Fourth band consists of circles with vegetal patterns in light violet and violet alternating with curved floral buds in red and yellow on a veined yellow ground.

label: Description
value: Polychrome interior cigar box label set in a white field. Design shows an eagle in flight over red letters: El Gran Mundo (The Great World). At left, a portrait; at right, a woman sits by the Havana harbor with a cornucopia of cigars at her feet. Behind is the lighthouse at Castillo del Morro and a ship. At center are four embossed gold medals.

label: Physical description
value: Lithograph, embossed bronze (possibly gold) powder and adhesive on rag paper

label: Provenance
value: Ellery Karl Dr.; 1975: acquired by Museum

label: Description

label: Description
value: A cornucopia is spilling an assortment of flowers; it is surrounded by butterflies and birds. An estucheon below the cornucopia is inscribed Jamesscoll (?) for W.L. Kenney, Nov. 1, 1796,  and an inscription appears in the lower left corner: Worked by Elizabeth Mercer, Nov. 1- 25 1796. With a traliling floral vine border on all sides. The fabric has been pieced: the field and borders are not of the same foundation fabric.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in chain, feather, couching, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Provenance

label: Description
value: Square carrying cloth (furoshiki) with the design of a bundle of seaweed and a flowering branch in the center of a blue-green ground. Light blue crest in one corner. Three pieces of fabric sewn together, the outer two selvage to selvage widths, joined prior to dyeing. The linear pattern is achieved by a resist paste. Four corner reinforced by three rows of running stitches radiating from the corner. Two sides reinforced by double row of running stitches. Top and bottoms hemmed. Small tassel at each corner.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: flat surface resist on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of Textiles Fund
